title: Lamb Tagine with Prunes
description: A legendary Moroccan meat tagine with caramelized prunes. The sweet and caramelized prunes work perfectly with the deep and richly spiced meat and onion sauce. This sweet and savory dish is a true masterpiece of Moroccan cuisine.
descriptionAr: طاجين لحم مغربي أسطوري مع البرقوق المكرمل. البرقوق الحلو يتناغم بشكل مثالي مع اللحم المتبل بعمق وصلصة البصل.
ingredients: Toasted sesame seeds or chopped roasted almonds for garnish
instructions: In a large casserole, heat olive oil to medium-high heat and brown the lamb shanks on each side. Make sure the pan is very hot - you should hear a sizzle when the meat touches the pan.
Remove the browned lamb shanks and set aside. In the same casserole, add the onions and lower heat to medium. Cover and cook until soft and translucent, about 10-15 minutes.
Add the lamb shanks, garlic, spices, salt and pepper. Pour 1½ cups of water (320ml) and place the coriander bouquet on top. Bring to boil, cover and simmer for 2 hours until meat is soft.
Halfway through cooking, reserve ½ cup of liquid from the casserole. If needed, add water to prevent drying out.
For caramelized prunes: Soften prunes in boiling water for 5 minutes, then drain. In a small skillet, combine reserved liquid, prunes, cinnamon and honey. Simmer for 5 minutes until thickened.
To serve: Arrange lamb shank and onion sauce on a plate, top with prunes and syrup. Garnish with sesame seeds or almonds. Serve with couscous or crusty bread.

title: Seven Vegetable Couscous
description: A traditional Friday dish in Morocco, this vegetable couscous is the foundation of all couscous recipes. Seven is considered a lucky number, and this colorful, aromatic dish brings together the best of Moroccan vegetables and spices.
descriptionAr: طبق الجمعة التقليدي في المغرب، كسكس الخضروات هو الأساس لجميع وصفات الكسكس. الرقم سبعة يعتبر رقم حظ، وهذا الطبق الملون يجمع أفضل الخضروات المغربية.
ingredients: 2 medium tomatoes, skin removed and chopped
5-10 sprigs each parsley and cilantro, tied together
instructions: In the bottom of a couscous pot (or large pot), add oil and turn heat to medium. Cook onions until translucent.
Add 10 cups of water, tomatoes and spices (salt, pepper, turmeric, ginger) as well as the cilantro and parsley bundle. Keep heat on medium low.
Add the hardest vegetables first: sweet potato, turnip, squash as they need the longest cooking time.
Steam couscous separately according to package instructions (typically 3 steamings of 20 minutes each, fluffing between steamings).
After first 20 minutes, add second batch: carrots, chickpeas, and cabbage.
After second 20 minutes, add remaining vegetables: zucchini and eggplant. Add hot pepper at the end if using.
Final steam (15-20 minutes) until all vegetables are tender. Give couscous a final fluff.
Serve couscous in a large dish, make a well in the middle and arrange vegetables on top. Reserve broth to serve on the side.

title: Harira Soup
description: A hearty, flavorsome Moroccan soup made with tomatoes, lentils, chickpeas, and warm aromatic spices. This satisfying soup is traditionally served during Ramadan to break the fast, but enjoyed year-round. Its velvety texture is what gives it its name (harir means silk in Arabic).
descriptionAr: شوربة مغربية دسمة ولذيذة مصنوعة من الطماطم والعدس والحمص والتوابل العطرية. تقدم تقليدياً في رمضان لفك الصيام، ويتم الاستمتاع بها طوال العام.
ingredients: ¼ cup long grain rice or broken vermicelli
instructions: In a large Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions, celery, and carrots. Season with salt and cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and spices (pepper, turmeric, cumin, ginger, cinnamon, cayenne). Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, cilantro, both lentils, and chickpeas. Add salt and cook for 5 minutes, stirring.
Add broth and bring to a boil for 5 minutes. Then reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 45 minutes until legumes are tender.
Check occasionally and add more liquid if needed. The soup should be thick but still pourable. Adjust salt as you add liquid.
Stir in rice and cook for another 15 minutes until rice is fully cooked.
Serve hot with lemon wedges. The soup thickens as it sits - add water when reheating if needed.

title: Chicken Bastilla (Pastilla)
description: A unique sweet-and-savory North African chicken pie with crispy phyllo pastry. Tender shredded chicken, spiced with Ras El Hanout, meets sweet dates and crunchy almonds in this celebratory dish that's as beautiful as it is delicious.
descriptionAr: فطيرة دجاج شمال أفريقية فريدة حلوة ومالحة مع عجلة الفيلو المقرمشة. دجاج طري متبل براس الحانوت، مع التمر الحلو واللوز المقرمش.
instructions: Pat chicken dry and season with salt and pepper. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Sear chicken until brown on both sides (about 5 minutes). Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add onions and garlic. Season with salt and cook until softened over medium heat.
Add ¾ cup water and all spices. Bring to a boil, then return chicken to the pan. Cook for 10-15 minutes until chicken is fully cooked and liquid has reduced by half.
Carefully remove chicken and shred into small pieces using two forks.
To the pan of liquid, stir in beaten eggs. The mixture will look like scrambled eggs - this is normal. Return chicken to the pan.
Stir in chopped dates, toasted almonds, and parsley. Remove from heat - filling is ready!
Preheat oven to 375°F. Brush a 10-inch pie dish or oven-safe skillet with olive oil.
Take one sheet of phyllo, fold in half vertically. Brush with olive oil. Lay in the pan with ends hanging over sides. Repeat with 7 more sheets, rotating the pan each time.
Spread chicken mixture over the phyllo. Cover with 2 more sheets (brushed with oil). Fold hanging phyllo edges over to cover. Brush top with oil.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until golden brown. Rotate pan for even color. Remove and dust with powdered sugar and cinnamon pattern before serving.

title: Moroccan Mint Tea
description: The quintessential Moroccan beverage, also called Maghrebi mint tea or Attay. This sweet, extra-fragrant tea is like a hug to the soul. Traditionally served in three glasses - the first as soft as life, the second as strong as love, and the third as gentle as death.
descriptionAr: المشروب المغربي quintessential، يسمى أيضاً شاي النعناع المغربي أو الأتاي. هذا الشاي الحلو والعطري جداً مثل عناق للروح.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon gunpowder loose leaf green tea
Small sprig of fresh sage or verbena (optional)
instructions: Put the gunpowder tea leaves in your teapot.
Boil water in a separate kettle.
Pour 1 cup of boiling water in the teapot and swish around to clean the tea leaves. This removes the strong, sour flavors. Pour this water out.
Now add the remaining boiling water to the teapot, leaving one inch of space at the top. Add the sugar.
Position teapot on stove over medium heat. Let boil for 1-3 minutes depending on how strong you like your tea.
Add the fresh mint, making sure it's all covered with water. Bend the branches if needed to fit. Let boil for another 1-2 minutes until slightly foamy.
Turn off heat. Wrap handle with cloth (teapot will be extremely hot).
Add orange blossom water or other aromatics if using.
Serve hot, pouring from a height to create a frothy head. Serve with cookies or pastries.

title: Moroccan Couscous
description: Bring juice and 1/2 cup water to a boil in a small pot. Remove from heat. Stir in couscous and allow to sit covered for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, in a separate pan, saute dates, raisins, almonds and cinnamon in 1/2 cup water for 2 minutes. Add cooked couscous. Mix well and serve warm. Makes 4 servings. Per serving: 301 calories, 8 grams protein, 59 grams carbohydrates, 4 grams fat, 0 grams saturated fat, 0 milligrams cholesterol, 7 milligrams sodium.
descriptionAr: كسكس مغربي تقليدي بالتمر والزبيب واللوز.
instructions: Bring juice and 1/2 cup water to a boil in a small pot. Remove from heat. Stir in couscous and allow to sit covered for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, in a separate pan, saute dates, raisins, almonds and cinnamon in 1/2 cup water for 2 minutes. Add cooked couscous. Mix well and serve warm. Makes 4 servings. Per serving: 301 calories, 8 grams protein, 59 grams carbohydrates, 4 grams fat, 0 grams saturated fat, 0 milligrams cholesterol, 7 milligrams sodium.

title: Moroccan Salad
description: Combine the bulgur wheat with the boiling water in a heat-proof bowl. Let stand 1 hour until the wheat has absorbed the water. Combine the remaining ingredients except the pita bread in a large salad bowl. Cut the pita bread into triangles. Place the triangles on a cookie sheet and bake at 350øF until crisp, about 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and add to the salad bowl. Drain any excess water from the wheat. Add to the salad bowl and mix well. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving. Per serving: calories 263, fat
ingredients: 2 tb Fresh lemon juice; plus 2 teaspoons
instructions: Combine the bulgur wheat with the boiling water in a heat-proof bowl. Let stand 1 hour until the wheat has absorbed the water. Combine the remaining ingredients except the pita bread in a large salad bowl. Cut the pita bread into triangles. Place the triangles on a cookie sheet and bake at 350øF until crisp, about 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and add to the salad bowl. Drain any excess water from the wheat. Add to the salad bowl and mix well. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving. Per serving: calories 263, fat
4g, 33% calories from fat, cholesterol 0mg, protein
5g, carbohydrates

8g, sodium 129mg. Exchanges: 1/2 Monosaturated Fat, 2 Starch, 1 Vegetable. The recommended wines are: Chenin Blanc, Chianti, or Fum Blanc. NOTES : Prep: 15 min, Marinate: 1:00, Cook: 15 min, plus refrigeration time.

title: Individual B'stillas (Moroccan Chicken And Almond Pies) Pt 2
description: half sheet of phyllo with short side facing you and brush with melted butter. On this, layer and brush 3 more half sheets of phyllo in the same manner. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon almond sugar on short side of phyllo nearest you to cover about 2 1/2-by 4-inch area, leaving a 1-inch border on 3 edges. Put 1/3 cup chicken mixture over almond sugar and spread out slightly. Top chicken mixture with 1 more tablespoon almond sugar and roll up filling in phyllo, folding in sides after first roll. Transfer b'stilla immediately. Form 8 more b'stillas in the same manner with remaining phyllo, butter, almond sugar, and chicken mixture, chilling each b'stilla as it is made. B'stillas may be prepared up to this point 4 hours ahead and kept chilled, covered lightly with plastic wrap once cold. Bake chilled b'stillas in oven until tops and ends are puffed and browned, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool b'stillas slightly on a rack. Sprinkle b'stillas with confectioners' sugar and cinnamon and serve warm. To make the ras el hanout: In a spice grinder or cleaned coffee grinder grind fine aniseed, fennel seeds, allspice berries, cardamom seeds, cloves, peppercorns, cinnamon stick, sesame seeds, coriander seeds, cuminseed, and red pepper flakes, In a small bowl stir together ground spice mixture, mace, ginger, and nutmeg until combine well. Ras el hanout may be stored in a tightly closed jar in a cool dark place up to 6 months. Makes about 1/4 cup. Makes 9 b'stillas, to serve 6 with second helpings.
instructions: half sheet of phyllo with short side facing you and brush with melted butter. On this, layer and brush 3 more half sheets of phyllo in the same manner. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon almond sugar on short side of phyllo nearest you to cover about 2 1/2-by 4-inch area, leaving a 1-inch border on 3 edges. Put 1/3 cup chicken mixture over almond sugar and spread out slightly. Top chicken mixture with 1 more tablespoon almond sugar and roll up filling in phyllo, folding in sides after first roll. Transfer b'stilla immediately. Form 8 more b'stillas in the same manner with remaining phyllo, butter, almond sugar, and chicken mixture, chilling each b'stilla as it is made. B'stillas may be prepared up to this point 4 hours ahead and kept chilled, covered lightly with plastic wrap once cold. Bake chilled b'stillas in oven until tops and ends are puffed and browned, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool b'stillas slightly on a rack. Sprinkle b'stillas with confectioners' sugar and cinnamon and serve warm. To make the ras el hanout: In a spice grinder or cleaned coffee grinder grind fine aniseed, fennel seeds, allspice berries, cardamom seeds, cloves, peppercorns, cinnamon stick, sesame seeds, coriander seeds, cuminseed, and red pepper flakes, In a small bowl stir together ground spice mixture, mace, ginger, and nutmeg until combine well. Ras el hanout may be stored in a tightly closed jar in a cool dark place up to 6 months. Makes about 1/4 cup. Makes 9 b'stillas, to serve 6 with second helpings.

title: Meshoui (Moroccan Lamb)
description: Preheat oven to 350F. All Vegetables should be coarsely chopped. Rub paprika, salt, pepper, and garlic all over lamb. Set aside. In a roasting pan, nestle lamb in the center of the vegetables and cook, uncovered for approximately 20 min (for 4-pound leg) or until top of lamb is brown. Add water, cover, and cook for 1 1/2 hours for medium done roast. Makes 5 servings. LAMB SAUCE: Strain Vegetables from roasting pan. Put drippings in a heavy pan. Add: 2 tb tomato paste and 1 quart of water. Simmer for about 15 minutes, skimming grease from top of sauce several times.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F. All Vegetables should be coarsely chopped. Rub paprika, salt, pepper, and garlic all over lamb. Set aside. In a roasting pan, nestle lamb in the center of the vegetables and cook, uncovered for approximately 20 min (for 4-pound leg) or until top of lamb is brown. Add water, cover, and cook for 1 1/2 hours for medium done roast. Makes 5 servings. LAMB SAUCE: Strain Vegetables from roasting pan. Put drippings in a heavy pan. Add: 2 tb tomato paste and 1 quart of water. Simmer for about 15 minutes, skimming grease from top of sauce several times.

title: Moroccan Fish
description: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix garlic, cumin, olive oil, pepper flakes, cilantro and lemon juice into a paste. Put the filets in a shallow baking dish and spread this paste over them. Cover tightly with foil. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 5 to 10 minutes (a little longer if the filets are thick). NOTES: * You could substitute other types of fish. : Difficulty: easy. : Time: 10 minutes preparation, 10 minutes cooking. : Precision: Approximate measurement OK.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix garlic, cumin, olive oil, pepper flakes, cilantro and lemon juice into a paste. Put the filets in a shallow baking dish and spread this paste over them. Cover tightly with foil. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 5 to 10 minutes (a little longer if the filets are thick). NOTES: * You could substitute other types of fish. : Difficulty: easy. : Time: 10 minutes preparation, 10 minutes cooking. : Precision: Approximate measurement OK.
